qas.question: Why does land availability have an effect on solar energy?

answers.text: solar panels can only be set up on land that is unowned and suitable for solar panels

qas.question: Why are roofs a good place for solar panels?

answers.text: many people have discovered that they can collect energy directly from their homes this way

context: In addition, land availability has a large effect on the available solar energy because <a0_0>solar panels can only be set up on land that is unowned and suitable for solar panels<a0_0/>. Roofs have been found to be a suitable place for solar cells, as <a1_0>many people have discovered that they can collect energy directly from their homes this way<a1_0/>. Other areas that are suitable for solar cells are lands that are unowned by businesses where solar plants can be established.
